website_summaries.verdict: A great value for removing a variety of dents yourself.
pros: Includes 24 different tabs for pulling out dents of a variety of different shapes and sizes
Can remove small and large dents
Features 40W hot glue gun with 10 glue sticks
Included tool bag keeps everything together
cons: Glue gun isn't of the best quality

customer_reviews.title: ... from parking lots and this title gem did a nice job of pulling them out
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple door dings from parking lots and this title gem did a nice job of pulling them out. I'd advise watching a few demo videos before you go at it and alcohol is key to releasing the adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: It works but be patient
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking that this item will magically remove your dent on the first attempt then dont buy this. To make this tool work, you need one thing that does not come with this kit and that is Patience. Multiple passes are needed to take out one dent, depending on size and shape of your dent. But I can guarantee you that, with every pass dent will be less visible than before. I am really helpful with how this worked out for me, give it a try yourself. check out my video on how to use this tool if you want to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Jasleen Kaur

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Comes with more parts/pieces I think I'll ever need. If done correctly, you'll save a lot by using this rather than taking to an body shop. Watch youtube videos and do it correctly. If you pull a ding incorrectly, you'll easily still see imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: PYoonit

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to use this to pop out some small hood and fender dings without any creases. According to the description, this was the perfect tool for that. After many attempts just to get one small dent out, it didn't budge. I didn't waste a lot of money on this product but I did waste a lot of time using it. Maybe the glue gun will come in handy on some other project.
customer_reviews.author: wbruiser2

customer_reviews.title: like pouring hot water
customer_reviews.text: Patience. Ultimate patience. I don't have it, maybe you do. This seems to do the trick after numerous attempts. Check youtube for tips, like pouring hot water, etc. It does help. This thing smells like armpit odor, kind of gross but it comes from the glue. I guess its some real cheap stuff so be careful not to inhale any of this stuff when it melts into the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good but be patient
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving a 5 star. I see that it does work. I have pulled out a few dents. Yes a few. It takes time like anything, you just have to work at it. Be patient with it and it'll work for you. Sometimes a dent pops right out and sometimes you have to work on it do it a few times but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Susana DeCouto

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: For the money I really did not expect much from this kit, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hot glue gun is a cheapy, but the rest of the kit is pretty good quality and it actually works. There a lots of u-tube videos on how to use such kits. The best piece of advice is to not let the hot glue dry more than two minutes, or you will end up turning an "inny" into an "outty".
customer_reviews.author: RANDY M. ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than The Cheapy I bought last year
customer_reviews.text: and only some of the plastic puller tabs have broken. . . I am not sold on these dent pullers over all though. . . but compared to the $16 ones, this one is much, much better built. . . I had all kinds of hail small dents to pull, and only about 10% of them pulled like I had hoped; some wouldn't pull at all, and some were so, so, and still had to fill them and I was doing a complete paint job anyway, but didn't want to have to fill a couple hundred dents.
customer_reviews.author: JimBoB

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: i was skeptical at first but im now a believer, this system really works. i was able to remove a huge dent in my daughters car and some door dings in my wifes. the smaller dings were tough but with a little work they are now nearly impossible to see. if i didnt show you where they were you wouldnt notice it.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money to remove smaller dents
customer_reviews.text: Had a few small dents on my hood from a minor deer strike and this pulled them out really easy! For $38 build quality isn't the best but will deffinlty get the job done a time or 2! Took me about 15 minutes for 5 smaller dents
customer_reviews.author: Techout

customer_reviews.title: It takes some time and practice to get this right ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time and practice to get this right. I watched numerous videos, but only had moderate success on getting dings out of 1994 Honda. It looked "better", but I couldn't get it "perfect". I talked to a pro, and there is a reason they typically go from behind the panel to work out the dings.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hoekstra

customer_reviews.title: Nice set...
customer_reviews.text: Very complete set. Appears to have everything I would need to pop out a dent on my car. The tools look and feel solid. It's winter in Chicago now, so I'm waiting for better weather so I can wash the car before attempting to remove the dent from my car door. Will update if I don't succeed.
customer_reviews.author: Jindrek Kowalczyk

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This item may work well on vehicles with thin sheet metal but on my Dodge Dakota it was useless since the glue would not stick long enough to even make a noticeable improvement. Cleaning the surfaces with iso alcohol made no difference as the glue came off either the body or the tool before the dents would budge even after several attempts. Perhaps a better glue stick would help?
customer_reviews.author: Feldgary

customer_reviews.title: Save the frustration, pay a pro.
customer_reviews.text: Save the frustration, pay a pro. I followed the instructions. Watched a few how-to videos on YouTube and did everything patiently and with care, and still I caused more damage than good. Every attempt to remove a hell dent caused a "high spot". I tried different glues, different puller tabs, different strengths, hard, soft, etc and I still couldn't perfect it. In my opinion, if you have a nice car pay the professionals. This requires skill to get it right. As far as the equipment, the puller worked but is fairly cheaply made. The tabs aren't the best.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Douglas

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start by saying this is a great deal! All the tools were of great quality and worked as they should. I used this on a 2012 Dodge Challenger and was frightened at first but was very impressed by it. I feel like I could fix any dent! Well... No dents bigger than the size of a fist LOL.
customer_reviews.author: David Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality parts
customer_reviews.text: The first time using it the set screw that holds the top handle to the gold puller broke. Three fourths of an inch will fit in the handle and three fourths of an inch will fit inside the puller. The part they provide is only 1 inch so when tightening everything up (because everything came very loose) that left one quarter of an inch for the lever action.
customer_reviews.author: Jangiel

customer_reviews.title: Did not fix the dent
customer_reviews.text: The cost is good for all of the items that you get. The concept of this tool works, but it does not remove the sent. The sent does get pulled out, but after you disconnect the tool, the dent metal springs back to the being a dent again. The only way to fix the body dent, is to carefully push the dent out from the back side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: World great! You have to play around with it to ...
customer_reviews.text: World great! You have to play around with it to get use to the process but does what it is suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: MIchael Aubin

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Short story: got a new car, noticed a tiny dent likely caused by small rocks on the road, bought this and took me less than 10 minutes to fix it in two tries. Now it is like nothing ever happened to that piece of area.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Looks new again
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed how easy it was to make my door ding disappear. Complete dent remover kit allows you to fix different size and shape car dents. No paint damage- repair kit didn’t harm the paint. Made me happy that I didn’t spend 100’s of dollars at body shop to fix my door. I would recommend this repair kit.
customer_reviews.author: Ron from Philadelphia

customer_reviews.title: Its not as easy as some people claim
customer_reviews.text: Its not as easy as some people claim. Now since I know better, I'd rather pay $1000 to a pro to remove dents than to take a chance and damage my paint with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: onyx1176

customer_reviews.title: Good first kit
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work well. Couldn't get full lift out of handle had to shorten spring to get lift. But it worked. First time doing good kit
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the part that was hot glued was made of plastic and did not withstand continued use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, glue comes off of those nipples and doesn't actually pop the dents. The tool itself is to short to get any real leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody That You Used To Know

customer_reviews.title: Removed without a notice.
customer_reviews.text: Great dent removal set. Used it to get rid of a dent someone left on my car sometime ago. It was easy to use and didn't damage paint in any way. Will definitely be using it in the future as the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Lidia Nevskaya

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Could have used a few more attachments but overall did the job for which I purchased
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Item is junk
customer_reviews.text: Item is junk. The first time I used the tool the plastic tab broke and left me with the glue and flat tab attached to my car.
customer_reviews.author: Etaylor727

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My car looks so much better without the fender dent! great product
customer_reviews.author: mando

customer_reviews.title: It worked.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked. Just tried it out on my wife’s Honda Pilot. ( it was dinged in a parking lot ). It took 3 easy tries and the ding was gone. Couldn’t even see where it was originally. Happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Depinto

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as advertised, the glue released before the dent is removed even after multiple tries.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Keep your insurance deductible, use this.
customer_reviews.text: Hey Y'all, don't pay a shop phat cash to remove hail dents- use this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Torretto

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and it does exactly what is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: kate nucci calo

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Hooking up the puller was a little cumbersome. Otherwise it works well.
customer_reviews.author: RaineyKay

customer_reviews.title: Huge money saver
customer_reviews.text: A decent, quality item for the price. Takes time to do it, but you can save thousands avoiding a shop. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S.

customer_reviews.title: Takes the dent right out of your car
customer_reviews.text: These tools worked great to remove the dent in my 2018 Chevy Malibu. I was frustrated by a $1900 quote from my dealer who was going to paint most of the car. This did the trick in no time. I'm very happy and satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Linn Van Wicklen

customer_reviews.title: Glue stuck to pull tabs
customer_reviews.text: At times the glue would stick to the black pull tabs. Fortunately there were enough tabs to keep working, but for the pull tabs where the glue was stuck on, I couldn't get it off. I emailed Mookis and asked them how to remove the glue from the tabs, but never heard anything back from them after 4 attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works need to practice a lot
customer_reviews.text: Worked but when weather was warm did not stick good and residue was a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Its very easy to use and understand works great. Worked on pulling dents out of my tail gate.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: so far so good, i got this kit thinking the pistol grip ...
customer_reviews.text: so far so good, i got this kit thinking the pistol grip item was the bomb, but no, but still a great kit, yes i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: stanley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool.  Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Just received this tool set. Tool is high quality machined aluminum. It could use a few upgrades, but the tool alone is a great deal for the price. I'm waiting on a five star until I test it. I will probably machine it and add upgrades after my first use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: No instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as expected in a timely manner. I gave it a low star rating because there were no instructions included. I was at least hoping for a something with a general overview of how the kit works.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Segrest

customer_reviews.title: The glue pops off easily without any pressure to pull out the ding
customer_reviews.text: No instructions included. Have to go online and watch videos. After several attempts, still has not removed ding. The glue pops off easily without any pressure to pull out the ding. Cleaned the area before so that's not the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Hill Country Mom

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Crap! Glue either sticks to tabs nearly impossible to get off.. or difficult to get off panel. Returning!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: Our old cars that had hail damage are looking better now.
customer_reviews.text: Handy little tools. Did the job. Our old cars that had hail damage are looking better now.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: That it works
customer_reviews.text: I used It works I been taking the dents of my Mercedes Benz clk320 fro hail damage
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as represented. Good quality, works well removing the dent in my car.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Merryman

customer_reviews.title: It is not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: It is not as easy to rid off the dents
customer_reviews.author: Josue Enrique Porcayo Leon

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Built
customer_reviews.text: Waste of $50. Does not work as described. Screws fell off it. The leverage with the handle is not enough to pull the dent. Cheaply built.
customer_reviews.author: MindBender

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I got dent on my car and that kit helped me make it way better than before good kit
customer_reviews.author: Vadim

customer_reviews.title: poor quality item
customer_reviews.text: it will pull your dents out, but expect the tabs to break and the puller to literally fall apart the first use
customer_reviews.author: bryan bennett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like that i had a problem with the glue gun and when i emailed the seller not only did they answer me promptly but they resolved the problem with the glue gun. The tool also works good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Will give it a try this coming weekend. Everything looks legit!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence L. Her

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My shipment came in with the scraper tool broken and no instructions as how to use the product.
customer_reviews.author: Flynn 71

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Glue is not strong enough to hold while pulling out dent

customer_reviews.title: parts poor quality
customer_reviews.text: the parts break so easily the plastic is so weak.
customer_reviews.author: Renato Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The slide hammer was very nice but the plastic pullers were just ok
customer_reviews.author: Tanner M.

customer_reviews.title: Pull gun does not work!
customer_reviews.text: The pull gun did not even work. The knob that’s suppose to adjust the height does not even work, which means you cannot pull the glue tab off. Talk about a waste of $30+.
customer_reviews.author: Mario E Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Realy good
customer_reviews.text: Exelent i fix a big dent easy to do i use acetone pure to remobe the silicon no isues
customer_reviews.author: Jose ayala

customer_reviews.title: This is a lot of good quality stuff for $35
customer_reviews.text: Works well. This is a lot of good quality stuff for $35.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Was working till i got to the third small dent and it pulled the paint off my car... do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Seth hansen

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty cheap, and almost works
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty cheap, and almost works. The pads are really use once and throw away since the glue always seems to stick to the pad rather than the car. A heat gun can get most the glue off the pads, however, but just doesn't really work as advertised. The popper tool does not work well at all, you need to use some vice grips on the knob to actually pull up on the pad. Pull to hard and the tab on the pad will extrude itself.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I have tried sever brands of these and this one worked fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Well I always wanted a glue gun. Right out ...
customer_reviews.text: Well I always wanted a glue gun. Right out of the box and right into work this thing failed completely on so many small levels. If I would do it over again I would pay a paintless dent remover professional/detailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me...
customer_reviews.text: Me and my friend tried for hours to remove a small dent on his motorized bike gas tank. Did not work at all..
customer_reviews.author: Joe H. Jaboro

customer_reviews.title: Great products and great company!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Hit a snag, but their team was super quick to respond and resolve! Awesome products! Would definitely buy from again.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time use with this tool! Horrible quality!

customer_reviews.title: looks like it should've worked
customer_reviews.text: Tried it, looks like it should've worked. Watched many videos and read technics. Just didn't work on any of the dents I tried it on. Hopefully others will have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the claning fluid is empty. is not working.... can I have one?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap!!
customer_reviews.text: Crap!!!!! Glue doesn't come off even with their adhesive remover or whatever it's called nor with rubbing alchohol. You can also adjust the hand puller as much as you want it still doesn't pull far enough to ever break free of the glue. Would've gave a zero if I had the option.
customer_reviews.author: Chris gemeny

customer_reviews.title: No instructions or glue release agent.
customer_reviews.text: I received the product with no instructions and no glue release agent. I just opened the box and will try it today. Will look for video instructions or something on the web. The tools look sturdy enough but will find out when I use them. First impression is not good. It’s quite lacking for a $57 product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blessing

customer_reviews.title: don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all and messed my clear coat paint up trying to remove glue, don’t waste your money!

product_meta.title: Mookis Paintless Dent Repair Tools Kit- Dent Removal Tools 41PCS with Golden Dent Lifter + Pops a Dent Bridge Dent Puller Kit + Tap Down Tools Rubber Hammer+ Glue Sticks[Glue Gun Included]
product_meta.description:
Size:41PCS
Mookis Paintless Dent Removal Tools- More Study, More Convenient 

About Mookis: 
Mookis is one the top professional Paintless Dent Removal Tools manufacturers to sell products relating to automotive, production line mainly on series accessories for auto dent repair application 

How to use this Paintless dent repair tools kit? 

1.Clean the dent surface with a wet cloth. Use alcohol to wipe off grease if necessary. 

2.Put glue sticks into the glue gun and preheat for 5-10 minutes. 

3.IMPORTSNT STEP: Choose a suitable puller tab and cover the tab with the extrude glue. Then apply the tab to the central of the dent quickly and press it slightly. Waiting for about 8 minutes no more than 10 minutes. Please remember DO NOT let the glue harden completely. 

4.Choose a suitable dent puller tool. In this dent removal kit, dent lifter are work on small dents and dings which are no larger than 5cm. Pops a dent bridge puller fit with the dents no more than 10cm. If your car dents are larger than 10cm, you can try to use the T-bar puller. You may use several tools to remove dents. 

5.Use the yellow scraper to remove the residual glue and use rubber hammer to flat your car surface 

Warning: 
--- glue sticks' best melting time is 5-8 minutes, Adhesive Cooling Time about 2-5 Minutes(Depends on temperature, no more than 10 minutes). 

Package included 
1* Golden Dent Lifter 
1*Bridge Dent Puller with 5 different type glue tabs 
1* T-handle dent puller 
1* Rubber hammer 
1* knockdown tools with 1 changeable head 
1* plastic glue scraper 
5* white glue sticks 
5* yellow glue sticks 
24 * Hot glue Pro tabs
feature_bullets: Easy to use- Designed to fix your car dents & dings. Complete dent remover kit with 3 functional Dent Pulling tools: Dent Lifter, Pops a dent Bridge Puller and T-bar glue puller. Each tool can work on different size and shape car dents.

No paint damage- Paintless dent repair kit do no harm to your car body. Without chemicals or other toxic material. So no harm to your body, too. Plastic scraper in this kit help you to remove the residue on your car easier and give your car a new look again.

High efficiency- 40W hot glue gun with 10pcs strong stickiness hot melted glue sticks. Only 2-4 melting time. Built-in fuse, makes it safer. Tools bag helps you organize these tools in seconds and no loss anymore.
Inspired design -Mental bridge dent puller(Not the plastic) with 5 pcs glue tabs is not only for car dent removal,but also can be used in hail damage and car door ding paintless repair.

Wide application-12 Different pro tabs for different shapes dents. Can be also used for refrigerator, motorcycle body, washing machine etc.. Tap down tools can help you flat the raised parts after pulling.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars519 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
